1035 45 or 1042 45 Twenty Eighth Sunday in Ordinary Time October 13 2024 special Thank You to Michelle and Stacey from our parish staff for all of their hard work in preparing for another successful Parish Picnic By our count this was the largest picnic to date Congratulations to our Chili Cook Off Winners 1st Eric Mechling 2nd Greg Lehman 3rd Dale McCorkle Our oor Prize Winners Kathy Marshall Beth Geisel and Liz Mock and our Guess the Number Winners Alex Mechling and Nate Mayer Special Collection for Hurricane Relief Next weekend we will have a special second collection to support the relief efforts for those effected by the recent Hurricanes Helene and Milton All donations will go to Catholic Charities and their relief efforts in the region Theology on Tap Angels and Demons Mark your calendars for our next Theology on Tap at Parlor City Brewery 212 Market St Bluffton on Tuesday Oct 29th starting at 6:30PM This event is open to all 21 as we turn our attention towards the spiritual side of creation Food and drink will be available for purchase at the Brewery The Liturgy of the Word to the Liturgy of the Eucharist Following the proclamation of the Gospel the Liturgy of the Word next continues with the Homily then the recitation of the Creed and finally the lifting up of the Prayers of the Faithful The Homily from the Greek word for conversation is meant to be part of the conversation between God and His people Not merely a moment of catechesis it is meant to be a moment proclaiming the great deeds of salvation and the demands of the covenant In the words of Pope Francis the Homily is meant to be a moment where it is God who seeks to reach out to us through the preacher and that He displays His power through human words The Homily gives way to the recitation of the Creed At Mass we profess the Nicene Creed These words originated from the Council of Nicea in AD 325 where the Church Fathers affirmed the divinity and humanity of Jesus In the Creed we make an explicit and deliberate profession of faith as our response to hearing the Word of God This parallels the Israelites response after Moses read from the book of the covenant All that the Lord has spoken we will do and we will be obedient Exodus 247 This profession of the Creed not only expresses what we believe but also recommits us to this belief May the words we profess in the Creed transform the very way we live Having professed the Creed together as one we continue this unity in the Prayers of the Faithful as we make our intercessions known before the Lord The Liturgy of the Word comes to a close as we lift up our prayers for others following St Paul's early instruction that supplications prayers intercession and thanksgivings be made for all men for kings and for all who are in high positions 1 Timothy 21 2 As the Liturgy of the Word concludes these intercessory prayers serve as a foretelling of the ultimate intercession of Christ crucified that approach in the Liturgy of the Eucharist The Liturgy of the Eucharist itself begins with the Offertory and the Preparation of the Gifts as the altar is prepared and a collection taken up to support the work of the Church All of this preparation and action is interlaced with vast symbolism and several quiet prayers As a whole the Liturgy of the Word is where we receive nourishment through the preaching and teaching of Christ Entering into the Liturgy of the Eucharist we now enter into the celebration of Christ's ultimate sacrificial act of love on the cross We note a change in the directionality of dialogue as the dialogue between the Priest and the Faithful gives way to a dialogue between the Priest speaking on behalf of the Faithful and God the Father Note If you will be away in the coming weeks for Fall Break remember that www.Masstimes.org is a great resource to help find local parish Mass times for weekend Masses when you are traveling In Christ Fr David Weekend of October 19th and who passed away August 3 2024 In your charity please also pray for the repose of the soul of Fr Daniel Mangen Precious Blood Priest residing in Chili brother of David Norma Jean Mangen who passed away October 9 2024 May God welcome them home fill them with peace and bless those who will miss them Eternal Rest Grant unto them Lord and let Perpetual light shine upon them May their soul and the souls of all the faithful departed through the mercy of God rest in Peace Amen To set up Online Giving through Our Sunday Visitor please visit httpswwwosvhubcomstjosephchurchblufftongivingfunds Your gifts MEMORIAL CANDLES November is All Souls Month as we remember our loved ones who have gone before us with Memorial Candles placed in front of Our Blessed Mother and St Joseph niches If you took candles home please bring them back before October 27th and place on the desk in the narthex or drop it off at the Parish office Donations for candles are appreciated BOLIVIAN MISSION PROGRAM If you sponsored a child through our Bolivian Mission Program and have not yet sent in your tuitionscholarship payment or wish to give a monetary Christmas gift please place in the offertory basket at Church or mail to the Parish office by October 25th We would like to send the final payment by the end of the month The Parish Office will be closed Monday October 21st and will re open Tuesday October 22nd at
